channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

item.title: [IPL-10411] Gender specific saluation for all emails
item.description:
Introduction

We want a gender specific salutation for all e-mails, like we do for letters.

Description
As-Is-Status Should-Be-Status
No gender spefific salutations e-mails Gender spefific salutations e-mails

Currently there is no gender sent to UMS in case it is a B2B order (i.e. when cdr_request_customer_group = 1). This is a BUG! In case of a B2B order the value in customers_address::ci_gender is empty. Instead the gender has to be fetched from customer_contact::cc_contact_person_gender in the data retrieval functions for the email service.

While doing the user story for letters (IPL-8454) - Anca found a solution, to do this also for e-mails:

Quote:
I also find a way to do this for emails. For tests I created a new email content 165746 SalutationFormula, which contains:

##Condition_Start####(gender='m')##geehrter##Condition_End##
##Condition_Start####(gender='f')##geehrte##Condition_End##
##Condition_Start####(gender<>'m' AND gender<>'f')##geehrte(r)##Condition_End##

I also created a test email 68461 DE - PM 3 - Total Discharge salutation test, which contains:

Sehr ||Content_165746[SalutationFormula]|| ##Tempfield_salutation##

For some java emails I've added the new gender parameter to the request for test purposes. So, after release we can change the UMS templates for these emails to use the new salutation formula.

Note: Send also gender for letter for B2B customers.

TODO
  • fix bug related to gender retrieval for B2B orders
  • implement logic & send gender parameter for all application e-mails
  • test e-mails
  • after release -> change email ums templates
item.summary: Gender specific saluation for all emails

comments.comment: Prio to be discussed in the next management planning meeting.

item.title: [IPL-10158] Adjustments for direct debit for Drive Now
item.description:
Introduction

We want a new payment method Bulk Direct Debit, where we collect several "orders" up to a specific amount or after a given time and then charge the sum of the order amounts at once.

Description
As-Is-Status Should-Be-Status
We can not process *.UDK files Possibility to process *.UDK files through sFTP upload

Pre-condition:

  • The customer must be scored positively for a specific amount (X€), via preauthorize XML-API.
  • The UID (unique id - temporary id) will be generated by DN during the check-out process

Process

  • Once a day DriveNow will send us an file with single orders in UDK format
  • The UDK file will contain the UID (merchant generated transaction ID) retrieved from the preautorize response and Mietvertragsnummer (= rental contract id), aditionally the new amount is delivered (see attachment UDK_Beispiel_für_BillPay.xls and UDK-Muster.dat)
    1) update order (UID + Mietvertragsnummer)
    Important! update order is currently possible by btid only
    2) EditCartContent (Mietvertragsnummer + new amount)
    3) InvoiceCreated (Mietvertragsnummer + new amount)

Three fields are relevant from the UDK file (see sample file UDK-Muster.dat):
a) adjustment/activation amount: UDK field 3.A "Beleg Betrag" - see UDK parser notation.docx
b) UID: UDK field 4 "Daten". Start to position of the "Z00" - 6 digits - see UDK parser notation.docx
c) Mietvertragsnummer: UDK field 4 "Daten". Start to position of the "Z00" + 6 digits - 10 digits - see UDK parser notation.docx

  • an response file in CSV format (see sample file 20130423170422_activate.csv) is generated for the customer after processing
    The file contains an error code and error message. Error code and error message can be the result of each of the three operations performed.

TODO: naming convertion for the import/export files.
example: YYYYMMDDhhmm_orders.udk
the importer can distingush .csv and .udk for choosing the right parser. this way, shell-script-wise we dont have to adjust anything.

Notes

  • no further exchange to synchronize the blacklist is needed

The following diagram shows the logic for processing the UDK-files

We agreed with Drive Now- that only activated orders can be canceled .(so we always get the Mietvertragsnummer, in the "Change Order" file)

Note: Drive now will always wait with a (full) cancel for 24 h* before putting it to the "Change Order" file. * 24 h after putting the order to the "accepted" file
Note: It's impossible to do a full cancel with ECC, therefore we have to call a FC request, when new amount is = 0. (can only happen in the "Change Order" file.)

TODO
item.summary: Adjustments for direct debit for Drive Now

comments.comment:
Anforderung

Voraussetzung: Kunden, die über DriveNow per LastSchrift mit Billpay machen wollen, werden initial positiv, via preauthorize XML-API, auf X€ von BP gescort.

    DriveNow lädt stündlich die Daten per CSV Order Import hoch
    Sämtliche LS Anfragen aus der CSV werden importiert und von uns im LS-Prozess verarbeitet (d.h. entweder sofort Einzug oder bei Überschreitung der Y€ Schwelle)
    Parallel zum Import wird jede Anfrage aus der CSV über ein anderes Portal gescort (ohne capture)
    Die Antwortdatei enthält enweder eine Erfolgsmeldung, für die positive gescorten Anfragen und ein DENIED für die abgelehnten

-> Der Integrationsprozess unterscheidet sich also im Vgl zu bspw Ideal nur dadurch, dass wir DENIED zurückliefern können in der CSV-Response (aber auch in diesem Fall verarbeiten wir die LS)
-> Kundendaten in der CSV dürfen sich im Vergleich zur initialen preauthorize XML-API Anfragen nicht ändern
-> Ein weiterer Austausch zur Synchronisation der Blacklist ist nicht nötig
-> Das funktioniert nur mit Lastschrift! Bei RK müssten wir die BV statt der Backlist Info zurückgeben.
-> DN darf uns keine Kunden mehr übergeben, für die wir schon den Blacklist Status zurückgegeben haben. Autom. Prüfen dieses Sachverhalts ist schwierig.
heute 11h Telko. Noch kein Vertrag da.
Do Abend mehr Infos.
@Alexej/Sebastian: könnt ihr bitte die TODOs für die Entwicklung zu gegebener Zeit hier dokumentieren.

TODO:
- portal basierten open orders check
- sammellastschriften
- klären: unfallschäden

aktueller stand:
- initiales scoring bei anmeldung über standard XML
- einreichung der fahrtenabrechnung (ED+IN) über UDK Format
- ED und IN in einem Schritt (-> spezielle Implementierung für DN)
- Anwortdatei für Fahrentabrechnung in CSV
- Schritt 2: Sammellastschrift implementieren
Contract Pending

Hinweis zu den verwendeten IDs:

Zum Zeitpunkt der Autorisierung am Fahrzeug kennen wir noch keine Mietvertragsnummer (MVNr).

Eventueller Prozess hierfür:

- Anlegen einer Platzhalter-UID bei Autorisierung
- Generierung einer MVNr durch Sixt Applikation nach Ende der Fahrt
- Übertragung der MVNr durch UDK-File
- Überschreiben der UID bei Fahrtenabrechnung
- Edit / Aktivierung der Fahrt mit neuer MVNr

[~jwehrs]: Können wir hier ohne Überlieferung der bptid einen Update Order durchführen? (Überschreiben von UID mit MVNr)

Kunde hat den Vertrag unterschrieben und vorab per Scan kommuniziert.

Integration ansstehend.
Change Order = JJJJMMTTHHMMSS_cancel.dat

item.title: [IPL-10089] DE - Heavy Load/Performance Test
item.description:
Introduction

We have to do a heavy load / performance test in order to check if we can process all requests via decision engine easily.

Description
As-Is-Status Should-Be-Status
NO-Status-Quo Have a performance test

The tests will be created with JMeter and runed from Jenkins, since JMeter offers scripting, and the performance can be recorded with the performance plug-in. (see reasearch results IPL-10527)

TODOs for this user story:

  • set up the Jenkins project
  • install/configure plugins
  • think about reasonable test scenarios
  • create confugration files necessary for the tests

The test scenarios should be defined by the management. Also, must be defined if the test is ment to record how the application behaves at this moment and use the results as base for the non-functional requirements or the non-functional requirements will be defined at first.

TODO

dsfgjog
item.summary: DE - Heavy Load/Performance Test

comments.comment: This article is probably worth to be read: http://jmeterworld.wordpress.com/2009/03/16/junit-sampler-tutorial-jmeter/

This estination is only about testing the DE.
The project should process the jmetter config files.
Those jmeter config files should be run from integration tests project with a profile load_tests.

The task is finished there will be a possiblity to define a test case in jmeter which will allow to send
preauthorize request to api,
or
to DE service for load testing.

item.title: [IPL-10080] DE - Create Integration Tests for preauthorize/capture request
item.description:
Introduction

We want to do regression / integration tests for our new decision engine. Note: This task will be specified during the 46. sprint. (so we know better what to test)

Description
As-Is-Status Should-Be-Status
Just integration tests for non-DE requests Integration tests for DE and non-DE requests

Create integration tests for Decision Engine:

  • Create preAuthorize tests for decision engine reusing already existing preAuthorize tests for non decision engine requests. Therefore create a new merchant (MID 500) with one or more portals that use the dummy workflow "dummy_it_test". Create the merchant via SQL insert file Don't duplicate all the test request files.
    If it is considered worth it and doable consider to make parametrize tests configuring them with (portal id, merchant id, merchant portal password) configurations.
  • Confirm that tests expected data is the same and can also be reused from existing tests.
  • Confirm that already existing tests for non-decision engine requests are still passing.

The following tests will be covered in the "Unit test" User Story (IPL-10079) and should be mocked for the created preAuthorize tests:

  • Workflow testing /Risk- Testing - requests Decision Engine/Non- Decision Engine;
  • Client/server interaction;
TODO
  • create SQL file for new merchant data that uses the dummy workflow ("dummy_it_test")
  • create 15 new tests for preauthorize request (test cases will be provided)

5 kind of test cases;

1
2 Customer with 3 open debts should be rejected
3 customer with high order amount, should be denied (limit reached)
4 customer which is whitelisted,(customer whitelisted)
5 Blaclkisted customer, should be denied blaclisted
item.summary: DE - Create Integration Tests for preauthorize/capture request

item.title: [IPL-10061] Extend FAQ and provide a new FAQ-button in the BO
item.description:
Introduction

We want to highlight our FAQs in the BO, in order to decrease the merchant requests the finance department receives.

Description
As-Is-Status Should-Be-Status
Just one small link to the FAQ & old FAQs One additional big button to FAQs & one new button to FAQ, with anchor to new chapter & new FAQs

Provide new additional button in the BO -> see screenshot

Add new text in the https://admin.billpay.de/static/faq/merchant_invoice_faq.html FAQ pop up. Content see attachment.

Note: There should be also a 3rd new button called "Bestellübersicht CSV Report" which links also to the FAQs, but with an anchor to the new chapter (new chapter: Bestellübersicht (CSV Reports))
(https://admin.billpay.de/static/faq/merchant_invoice_faq.html#_Bestelluebersicht_csv_report)

TODO
  • extend FAQs
  • Implement 2 new buttons to the BO.
item.summary: Extend FAQ and provide a new FAQ-button in the BO

comments.comment: please call the 3rd Button "Bestellübersicht CSV Report"

item.title: [IPL-10826] (IPL-10158) Create Wrapper SP for new "Update Order"
item.description:
Create a SP that extract the "p_tx_id" (transactionId) from (UID(transactionId/merchant_invoice_number ) + contractId(Mietvertragsnummer)) and call the existing Update Order SP (ipl_api.update_order) which is only considering the "p_tx_id" (transactionId).

Check if the current update SP does not forbid changing of merchant reference number if merchant ref is already assigned to the order. If yes provide clean solution

Verify if current API tests cover this procedure.
item.summary: (IPL-10158) Create Wrapper SP for new "Update Order"

comments.comment:
Using of ipl_api.update_order is not possible, because SP forbid changing of merchant reference number, if merchant ref is already assigned to the order.

Solution:
1. creation of helper function ipl_api.update_merchant_reference for updates co_merchant_order_id to the contract_ID in the customer_order table.
2. using of helper function in the new "wrapper" - procedure.
3. Also using of the helper-function in the existing pl_api.update_order procudure (cause: don't duplicate of updating code)

Manualy testing for invoice and direct debit for activated and non activated order.
also tested the old procedure update_order.
@Anca, please review it

Befor the change, send a ums string, see if its correct,
Make the change,
Send a ums string and see if the resulsts are the same.

Sehr ||Content_165746[SalutationFormula]|| ##Tempfield_salutation##

item.title: [IPL-10819] Status update after manual manipulation of dunning fees through BO
item.description:
The main user story is about adjusting the dunning fees per debt manually.

Because this is a manual process (non-standard) process- there is no need for triggering e-mails (done manually by CC) or status update.

But, if there is an adjusting of dunning fees, there can be cases, where the order become paid_full (or paid_over) afterwards.

To solve this problem, we have to trigger the proc check_debt_status after each time we manipulate the dunning fees.

Note: Please think about possible test cases.

Test case 1:

Order total worth 100
Customer Status: Dunning 1
Dunning fee = 4 euro
Bank transfer = 103 euro
adjusting dunning fee 1 = from 4 to 3 euro
order should be paid full now

Test case 2:

Order total worth 100
Customer Status: Dunning 1
Dunning fee = 4 euro
Bank transfer = 109 euro
adjusting dunning fee 1 = from 4 to 9 euro
order should be paid full now

Test case 3:

Order total worth 100
Customer Status: Dunning 1
Dunning fee = 4 euro
Bank transfer = 104 euro
adjusting dunning fee 1 = from 4 to 3 euro
order should be dunning 1 now
item.summary: Status update after manual manipulation of dunning fees through BO
